dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex is trying his key in the front door of his house. Fin it doesn't, work he rattles the knob, then leans on the  doorbell. We hear distant chimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey! ...Honey?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, through the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex. Get away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Marylin, can't we have a  civilized discussion about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are. And it's winding down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Marylin, you know a divorce would  ruin me right now. Everything I have --  everything we have -- is tied up in  my business. The business is my entire  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you forgetting about the Atcheson,  Topeka and the Santa Fe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex. Go away. I don't want to have  to sic the dogs on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside the house we hear the menacing sound of LARGE DOGS BARKING.

dialogues.speaker: LETTERING
dialogues.text: On an interior wall; it says MASSEY, MEYERSON, SLOAN &amp GURALNICK. A pull back shows that we are in a waiting room, and a  receptionist leans over her partition to chirp at Rex Rex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Massey will be right with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles addresses a group of young Attorneys at the firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is that everyone is  willing to compromise. That's the  problem with the institution of  marriage -- it's based on compromise.  Even through its dissolution. One  attorney will try to score some  points, the opposition will try to  impeach. The process will find an  equilibrium point determined by the  skill of the opposing lawyers, and  then each party will walk away with  their portion of the "goodies." Some  say, "Life is compromise." But at  Massey Myerson we believe life is  struggle and the ultimate destruction  of your opponent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist pokes her head into the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eleven o'clock is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen -- we will  continue this at the Associates  Meeting next Friday. In the meantime,  I want you to consider this... Ivan  the Terrible, Henry the VIII, Attila  the Hun -- what did they have in  common?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle names?

dialogues.speaker: MILES MASSEY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: You may have seen it in the issue before last of "World o Interiors." There's a Rothko on the wall, an Elle Bleu hu on the desk, peonies in the vase, and the diploma is from Yale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rexroth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles Massey. Please sit, relax, and  consider this office your office,  your haven, your war room -- for the  duration of the campaign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Rex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back in the leather executive chair behind his d makes a steeple of his fingers, and dons his look of deep concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Tell me your troubles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex, nervous, laughs ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez. Where do I start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles gives an encouraging, rueful smile in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well, my wife has me between a  rock and a hard place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her job. You have to respect  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I first met Marylin -- Well, we  were crazy about each other. Not  emotionally, of course. We just  couldn't keep our hands off each  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then... But then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time marches on. Ardor cools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not exactly. It didn't exactly  cool. Marylin is a knock-out. And  very sexy -- but -- there's a lot of  it out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean when I say "it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha. No need to get anatomically  correct with me, Rex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like there's more of it than  ever before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, with the expanding global  population -- Let me ask you this --  your wife. Has she pursued the  opportunities which must present  themselves to the "knock-out, sexy  woman" you described?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I can assume...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in court you can't. Has she  retained counsel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your wife is aware of or has  evidence of your activities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm... And to cut to the chase,  forensically speaking -- is there a  pre-nup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex hangs his head. Miles sighs sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fault, dear Brutus, is not in  our stars, but in ourselves. Well,  let me ask you this: what kind of  settlement do you seek? What are,  for you, the parameters of the  possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem. I can't afford  to give her anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that sounds rough but I'm  about to close on a deal to develop  some mini-malls, and I'm mortgaged  up to my ass. If this deal goes south,  I'm ruined -- I'll lose millions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you propose that in spite of  demonstrable infidelity on your part,  your unoffending wife should be tossed  out on her ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin power walks along the San Vicente Bike Path with friends SARAH SORKIN and RAMONA BARCELONA. It's early, bu the path is crowded with bikers, bladers, runners, power  walkers, wheelchair racers etc. Ramona pushes her infant a baby jogger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come out to the beach  house tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know Barry had a beach house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither did I until my lawyer found  it -- quite a paper trail -- he had  it in the dog's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Marylin) So who'd you hire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth Rabino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a legend. Didn't she do Kravis  or a Pearlman? She definitely did a  Factor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did a Harriman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the words of my Private  Investigator, we're going to nail  his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to nail George's  for years, but he's very careful.  I'll just keep having children. I  think I'm pregnant, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona! Don't get Mia Farrow on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three is not Farrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Rex's guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles Massey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Massey Myerson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By reputation. He got Ann Rumsey  that cute little island of George's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George was so impressed he hired him  when he divorced his second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muriel Rumsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? She's a night manager at  McDonalds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have tried to get pregnant  Marylin -- solidify your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't have a baby with a man I  don't love... And I can't submit a  child to divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so bad these days. Kids  like joint custody. Two sets of toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do have a man for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorstenson Gieselensen. He just  separated from his third. He's in  fish. He is fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's keeping his name. And one of  his planes. And all seven of his  children

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And only two are hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'm not seeing anyone until  this is over. One husband at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had your discipline.

dialogues.speaker: A COURTROOM
dialogues.text: We are close on the person on the witness stand, a woman her 60's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Guttman, you have testified  that you were your husband's sexual  slave for thirty-six years, ever  since you were married --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for two years when he was in  the Navy, in Korea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prior to your marriage, what was  your profession?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a hostess. For Trans-World  Airlines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your husband's profession?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He manufactures staples and industrial  brad-tacks. He's very successful.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP BACK
dialogues.text: At the counsel's table in the foreground Miles chats, voi lowered with WRIGLEY, a boyish, bespectacled junior assoc Beyond them we see the woman on the witness stand continu her testimony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... He wants to give her...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she has...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles turns to Wrigley with a look of indignation. He ges to their surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I have serious doubts about  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I mentoring the wrong mentee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be mentoring Kramer. Kramer  clerked for Scalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley looks suicidal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't you simply walk away from  this abusive relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he had the videos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I need a challenge. This --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves dismissively at the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- is not a challenge. I need  something I can sink my teeth into,  professionally speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would invite these girls home  from the staple factory to our  condominium in Palm Springs. He had  a device he called the Intruder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Massey! I ask again, if you have  any questions for the complainant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, your honor, I was just  conferring with my associate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now then, Mrs. Guttman. Do you know  a gentleman named Morris Rudnick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes, Morris is my accountant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly) Accountant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches back and Wrigley puts a manila file in his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would like to offer these  photographs into evidence...

dialogues.speaker: WAITING ROOM
dialogues.text: The receptionist leans over her partition to chirp at Mar and her attorney Ruth Rabinow. Ruth is a sturdy woman in late 60's. If Mrs. Guttman had gone to law school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Massey will see you now.

dialogues.speaker: CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: In the middle of the Massy Meyerson conference table is a large fruit and pastry plate. The door swings open. Miles rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ruth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ruth Rabinow, this is Rex Rexroth.  And you must be Mrs. Rexroth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you must be Mr. Massey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They appraise each other for a beat. They are impressed a they are impressive. As they settle in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sadly) Hello, Rex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? You lost weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My whole metabolism is -- off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles has been staring at Marylin. She notices this, and  smiles shyly. He snaps out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Ruth. How's Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is Sam. He's taking up fly  fishing. He's in a yert in Montana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A yert. (To Rex) Ruth is a living legend, Rex. At a  time when most women are in Boca,  having early bird specials -- she's  working so her husband can be in  Montana. In a yert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a yert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Dryly) I ran into your mother at the  radiologist last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just a routine mammogram. She  said to say hello. She's going to  Positano with your brother's family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tight, terse smile from Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positano is beautiful. Remember when  we were there, Rex? We stayed in the  Santo Pietro? That hotel on the cliff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drift for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Miles. If you have a proposal,  let's hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point my client is still  prepared to consider reconciliation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client has ruled that out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client is prepared to entertain  an amicable dissolution of the  marriage without prejudice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's delusional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client proposes a thirty day  cooling off period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client feels sufficiently  dispassionate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client asks that you not initiate  proceedings pending his setting  certain affairs in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha Ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conceding the point) Heh heh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so goddamn funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles lays a hand on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- let me handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the clipboard away and looks carefully at Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- So much for the icebreakers.  What're you after, Ruth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client is prepared to settle for  fifty percent of the marital assets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why only fifty percent, Ruth? Why  not ask for a hundred percent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh brother. Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not a hundred and fifty percent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Maybe you're right, Miles. Maybe  we're being too conservative. Seventy  five percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex winces. Rubs his stomach. Marylin leans forward and  whispers to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need a Tagamet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She removes a pack of the tablets from her purse, along w several vials of prescription drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not according to Mrs. Rabinow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the pills to a grateful Rex. Their hands touch a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been taking your digestive  enzymes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Contrite) Sometimes I forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him like a concerned parent. Miles and Ruth  watch the interaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the attorneys) I'm sorry. Where were we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were about to request the primary  residence, and thirty percent of the  remaining assets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with Kirshner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirshner does not apply. Kirshner  was in Kentucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Kirshner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- let me handle this. Okay,  Ruth, forget Kirshner -- what's your  bottom line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The primary residence and FORTY  percent of the remaining assets.  You're becoming tedious Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't we going in the wrong  direction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Please. Let me do my job. (To Ruth) Buy a clue, Ruthie. Have you forgotten  about Kirshner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth stands and closes her attachГ© case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you at the preliminary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles calls to Ruth's retreating back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. We'll eat all the pastry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going through the door, Ruth doesn't react, but Marylin  following, glances back -- bemused, but with a trace of a smile. Rex swallows two more tablets. He sits, looking desponden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that went as well as could  be expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She always looked out for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she had private investigators  assisting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sentimental) She brought my digestive enzymes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In anticipation of making you sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should reconsider my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks at him. Shakes his head, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A superficial display of marital  solicitude, and you lose your resolve?  Rex. I underestimated you. But I'm  your attorney, and if you choose to  reward her for that mediocre charade  of spousal concern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs, helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Screw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman walking across a gymnasium floor. Suddenly, she's assaulted by a huge, grotesquely garbed assailant. His sw barely cover his massive, overdeveloped musculature. On h head, a ski mask stretches over a padded football helmet. grabs the woman, yanks her back towards him. She reacts  swiftly. With a ferocious "NO," she stomps on his foot, a smashes him in the face. The mugger raises his hands in a gesture of submission.

dialogues.speaker: APPLAUSE
dialogues.text: We pull back and see that we are in a Self Defense Class. Two instructors, two "muggers" and ten women students all wearing T-shirts with the words IMPACT-Personal Safety.  Marylin and Sarah sit against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what his game is. He  dismissed every one of Ruth's  proposals. And Sarah, we weren't  unreasonable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Ruth kept her cool,  but I could tell she was surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a reputation for being tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin watches as a new "victim" begin her walk across t gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grinning) Lilly's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mugger emerges from his station and makes his way tow the "victim." She glances over her shoulder, and at the s of the monster bearing down on her, screams and runs to t exit. Marylin and Sarah giggle, but reproachful looks fro the other students force them to affect concerned looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispers) Every week --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Instructors and the Mugger try to coax the sobbin woman back into the room. They clasp her in an empathic g hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, even Rex seemed perplexed by  his intransigence. If I didn't know  better, I'd swear Massey had some  personal investment in my ruination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where are you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if he continues to maintain  this position -- we're in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this! He called and invited me  to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INSTRUCTOR, a vivacious phys ed major, approaches Mar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin? Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, yeah. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin gets up and coolly walks to center stage, passing the traumatized Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's completely odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin begins the Victim walk. The Mugger quickly moves from the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Sarah) I know. That's why I accepted. Find  out what's up with this clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mugger is upon her. He grabs her hair. She stomps his foot, and smoothly wheels around SMASHING him in the nose with her elbow, while KNEEING HIM in the groin. The women Cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was excellent, Marylin. But you  forgot to yell "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. (Calmly, to the Mugger) No.

dialogues.speaker: ELEGANT RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: Miles rises from his seat as Marylin enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Rexroth. Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maitre d' is pulling out a chair for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to admit. I was curious. And  hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something to start? Some wine,  perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles glances at the wine list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French? (She smiles) Bordeaux? Hmmm. Chateau Margaux '57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles nods at the maitre d' who returns the nod and withd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume this is on Rex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles regards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband told me you were  beautiful, but I was unprepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dismiss your vows, your feigned  tears, your flattery, for where a  heart is hard, they make no battery."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles leans back, props his chin on one fist, and conside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon & Garfunkel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a hard heart, Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the tape. Then we can discuss my  heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter appears and pour a taste of wine which Miles sip and -- He nods at the waiter who pours two glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Mr. Massey. What was your  performance about this afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does your lawyer think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth says you've been too successful,  that you're bored, complacent, and  you're on your way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. I was hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAP a menu enters frame. It is handed to Marylin; anothe is handed to Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have the tournedos of beef. And  the lady will have the same? (To Marylin) I assume you're a carnivore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She addresses the waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Risotto with white truffles, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks at her with appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Who ever lov'd that lov'd not at  first sight?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't ask me here to pick me  up. You could get in trouble for  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. You're not my client.  Freedom of association. Big issue  with the First Amendment fans. Want  to go to Hawaii for the weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been married, Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, I'm a huge fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just haven't met the right person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I haven't. Have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She regards him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Miles. Let me tell you  everything you THINK you know. I was  married to Rex for a long time. I  was an excellent wife, a partner, a  lover, a hostess and a friend. There  was only one thing I did wrong during  the five years we were together. I  got five years older. Think he should  be able to ditch me for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants a reconciliation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the tape. Then we can discuss  reconciliation. Rex screwed up and I  nailed his ass. Now I'm going to  have it mounted and have my  girlfriends over to throw darts at  it. Then I'm getting on with my life.  That's all I'm after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you're after, Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm a lot like you -- just looking  for an ass to mount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't look at mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oyez. Oyez. Family court for the  fifth district of Los Angeles County  is now in session.

dialogues.speaker: COURT ROOM
dialogues.text: A large black woman in judicial robes and raiment enters  from behind the Solomonic Platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The Honorable Marva Munson  presiding. All rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massey, Wrigley, and Rex Rexroth in between, rise. Rex an Wrigley remain respectfully standing, facing forward, as  they whisper out of the side of their mouths:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you sat before her before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the judge sits. We argue. We argue  before her. She sits before us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Has she sat before you before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't sit before her. That's the  rule! She sits before we argue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles glances over and hisses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut! Up!

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: We are on a close lateral track of the jurors faces as th sit, with earphones on, in the darkened courtroom, illumi by a flickering TV monitor. Leaking tinnily through the headsets we hear a very faint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna nail your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The track ends over at Marylin's table, where Marylin als wearing headphones, looks on with studied stoicism. Ruth  lays a consoling hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Marylin Rexroth now struggles to maintain her composure o the witness stand. She is modestly dressed and her attitu is one of shocked, wounded innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was devastated. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mrs. Rexroth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Massey, any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles soberly rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces, hands clasped behind his back, affecting to be  lost in thought. Marylin watches him. Finally Miles, still pacing, declaims:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dismiss your vows, your feigned  tears, your flattery, for where a  heart is hard, they make no  battery..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin looks up from her handkerchief with a look of sta irritation. Miles stops pacing and turns to face her with faint smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know those lines, Mrs. Rexroth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin examines him with guarded eyes. Ruth sensing some unscripted going on, tries to cut it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection, your honor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... poetry recitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me rephrase. Mrs. Rexroth, how  high is that wall around your heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin eyes him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, this is harassment! Arid  frankly it's still a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flutters one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...arty farty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rephrase. Mrs. Rexroth, have you  ever been in love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin hesitates, gives a "what does this mean look" to  Ruth. She returns a "beats me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I loved my husband, Rex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've always loved him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles slips out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Who ever lov'd that lov'd not at  first sight?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles returns a fleeting smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you hoped to spend the rest of  your life with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Why is that so difficult for  you to understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Rex with tender sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex was -- is -- a very appealing  man. I am sorry I couldn't... (Tearing up) I tried my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles almost smiles. She's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be all Mrs. Rexroth. Please  forgive me for causing you additional  anguish. (To the Judge) Thank you, Your Honor. No further  questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Bailiff offers to help Marylin off the stand. She polit and courageously declines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's next, Mrs. Rabinow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We rest, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Massey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your honor. I call Patricia  Kennedy DeCordoba Isenberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patricia Kennedy DeCordoba Isenberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin, in the process of reseating herself behind her t pauses. Ruth notices this and leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An attractive woman in her mid fifties advances to be swo She was a beauty, but her glory days are past and she's n taking it well. She looks tense and slightly hypo-manic. speaks in a breathy, giggly voice, and smiles frequently no apparent reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Isenberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banderas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Banderas, do you solemnly swear  that the testimony you are about to  give shall be the truth, the whole  truth, and nothing but the truth so  help you God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Bailiff. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mrs. Banderas. What is your  relationship to Mrs. Rexroth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have much of a relationship  anymore. I haven't seen her since  before she married Rex. We had some  very nice times prior to that. We  were quite close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Marylin) Is this a lover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how would you define your  relationship to Mrs. Rexroth. You  know -- you are her...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patricia smiles coyly. Gives Marylin a silly little wave way of greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to believe I know. I'm sure you  are frequently mistaken for sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mumbles) He'll regret this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever met Mr. Rexroth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I haven't. But I've been out of  town. (Little girlish wave) Hello, Rex. Hello there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were never invited to meet your  son-in-law?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Uh uh. I don't think so. Hmm?  No. Well... no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection, Your Honor. This isn't  about Mrs. Rexroth's filial  obligations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know Mrs. Rexroth was married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Of course she was married.  What else would she be? Single? I  don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs merrily at some private joke between her and h psyche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something about Patty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's "Patty."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That's her name. Patricia. Like  mine. I was Pat and she was Patty.  But she changed it after seeing "Some  Like It Hot." To Marylin. After  Marylin Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. And what were you going to  tell us about Patty slash Marylin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she was a tiny girl? And people  asked her what she wanted to be when  she grew up? She never said the usual  things little girls say -- like --  nurse -- ballerina -- anchorwoman?  She always said -- (Very Shirley Temple) "When I grow up, I want to be  divorced."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs happily at the memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divorce was her childhood aspiration?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not just divorce. She used to  say "I want to be divorced from some  big dumb rich guy..." And I guess  her dream is coming true. (To Marylin) I'm happy for you Patty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pasta being cooked. Salad being tossed. Wine glasses are  filled. It's Girl's Night at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like that scene in The  Godfather. Frankie Pentangeli is  called to testify against the Family.  And he's in court, and he looks into  the spectators gallery, and sees his  Brother. They brought the brother  from Sicily. And Frankie can't say a  word. He can't testify. That's what  it was like seeing Pat in there. I  couldn't even have Ruth cross examine  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think she did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shrugs) Maybe she wanted a free trip to LA.  Maybe they offered her money. Massey  is very seductive. Who knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they put a horse head in her  bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stinks. They left you with  absolutely nothing. It makes you  wonder about the entire legal system.  Like Rodney King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bought her speech. If I was  only in it for Rex's money, he  shouldn't have to give me any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make sense. It's like  punishing you for being goal oriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can live here as long as  you want. Do you have any plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing specific, but I'll have my  own place soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Marylin. Is that what you said  when you were a little girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. Every woman in my life was  divorced at least twice. What was I  supposed to say. Anthropologist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I begged you to have a baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Godfather, after the courtroom  scene, Frankie Pentangeli opens his  veins in the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll see some blood before this  is over, but it won't be mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is at his weekly chess game with his college friend DR. KENNETH BECK, a disaffected plastic surgeon. Miles, C in hand, studies the board. Dr. Ken sips his Merlot. Move piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got absolutely nothing. Zero.  Zip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. I won't be seeing her? Your  clients usually visit me after the  settlement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this one. Not unless her HMO  covers plastic surgery, which,  incidentally, she does not need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone needs plastic surgery. You  need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want Botox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is Botox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a form of botulism. I just inject  it into your forehead, and it  paralyzes your eyebrows so you can't  raise them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why in God's name would I want...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No frown lines. (Notices Miles watch) New watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a LeCoultre Revers. You can  flip the face, and set it for two  time zones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you need two time zones?  You never leave Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a gift from a client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set one side for Bel Air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Botox. Christ. We had aspirations  when we were in college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to be a Cardiac  Surgeon. I was going to clerk for  the Supreme Court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to play golf. You were  going to have Asian girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denial is not a river in Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth moves a chess piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be in therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles addresses BONNIE DONOVAN, a client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Your husband did show remarkable  foresight in taking those pictures.  And, yes, absent a swimming pool,  the presence of the pool man would  appear to be suspicious. But Bonnie,  who is the real victim here? Let me  suggest the following. Your husband,  who on a prior occasion slapped you --  beat you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reacts) Well, I wouldn't say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband, who has beaten you --  repeatedly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- was at the time brandishing  your firearm, trying in his rage to  shoot an acquaintance -- friend of  long standing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hate each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he says now! But if not for your  cool headed intervention, his tantrum  might have ended this schmoe's life  and ruined his own... As for the  sexual indiscretion which he imagined  had taken place, wasn't it in fact  he who had been sleeping with the  pool man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares contemplatively at the ceiling and, after a bea responds to the silence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I going to far here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squawk box interrupts with a female voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Massey, Mr. Meyerson would like  to see you when you have a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb wants to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you have a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slatted shades are drawn against the sun. It is dim, gloo We can just make out the shape of an ancient man -- small hunched -- seated behind an enormous desk. A gallows shap next to him is hard to make out; it is tall, rail thin an fixed with a swinging, glinting appendage. A voice -- old, dry, rasping, lightly accented of a long- gone Brooklyn boyhood -- seems disembodied and sourceless as if it is the voice of the gloom itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thoity-six objections sustained,  tree overruled; fawteen summary  judgements sought, toiteen ranite,  eighteen movments to voice fuh  respondent's prejudice, eighteen  ranite which is a hunnut pissent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arm is being extended toward us and the glinting appen swings with it: we see that it is an IV which snakes down and into the hunched man's suit sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Twelve cawt days on the Rexrawt  case alone; tree hunut'n twenty  billable hours paralegal soivicies;  four hunnut'n two billable associate  counsel and consultative; six hunnut'n  eighty billable at full attorney  rate and eightyfive lunches charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles takes the man's offered hand, withered and roped wi veins, and accepts its clammy shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Counseluh, you are the engine  that drives this foim --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back in his chair, breathing heavily, and runs a tongue over his sandpapery lips. He is wearing oversize S Lazar style glasses, heavily tinted in spite of the dark. At length

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Herb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sits behind his desk, fingers steepled, staring at  nothing, a haunted look on his face. His intercom SQUAWKS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Massey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! No calls! I'm feeling very  fragile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Massey, but I felt  certain you'd want to know -- Marylin  Rexroth wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin Rexroth? When does she --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles runs his fingers through his hair, carefully examin himself in the mirror. Suavely smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin! How nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clears his throat, begins again with lower pitch, suav smile still in place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin! How lovely, uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs a finger across his teeth, which squeak, then put back the suave smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Marylin! What a pleasure --

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: On Miles as he opens the door, suavely smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin, what a pleas -- who the  fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing him in the doorway is a large roughly handsome mid aged man in a business suit. Just behind him is Marylin Rexroth, looking as coolly  beautiful as ever. She smoothly puts in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, how nice of you to see us --  may I introduce Howard D. Doyle of  Doyle Oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you we know each other, baby.  Mr. Massey represented my ex-brother- in law. Martin Reiser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. Won't you have a seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Marylin) After you, Doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin glides into the office. Seats herself on the couc Doyle sits next to her, one proprietary hand on her knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how is Mrs. Reiser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few suicide attempts, little inpatient  stint. Naturally, she misses her  kids. Six weekends a year and  alternate Yom Kippurs seemed harsh  to us but -- hey -- all's fair.  Anyhoo, she lives with a "nurse,"  takes her meds and goes to  occupational therapy at a local  sheltered workshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she's uh, flourishing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes felt wallets. Got one right  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle pulls out a deranged piece of felt stuffed with mon Most of the contents slip to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. Leather would be more  practical, but whatcha gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, I know you're busy and that  you charge by the hour so I'll come  to the point. Howard and I are  planning to marry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muh -- Well, uh -- Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. My divorce just came through.  Shoulda called you. Coulda cut a  better deal! My wife still has health  insurance and gets to see the  children. But, I don't know. Guess  I'm just a softie. After all Amanda  and me were together for -- what --  you'd know better than me, Marylin.  She was your best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Thinks) Sixteen years? Howard Jr. is fourteen  and Mandy must be what -- twelve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Miles) Here. Got pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes a family photo from the felt wallet. It's of H and two fat teenagers. Apparently the former Mrs. Doyle w cut out, but an ear and part of a hairdo are sill visible the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... uh guess congratulations are in  order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- Marylin and Rex broke up  and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I don't think this is really  relevant to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and one day, this sweet girl calls  me, asks me to lunch. Just a shoulder  to cry on deal. One thing leads to  another and before I know it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we realized we'd always been very  attracted to one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea until after, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her with predatory lust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby. You are so HOT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Coy) Howard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her close to him and plants a massive kiss on he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a touching story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Miles, after my wife --  wife's mastectomy -- things were  never the same. This might sound  cold, well, maybe not to you, Massey,  but... (man to man) I like my women with two boobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles flashes Marylin a "you are KIDDING" look, but she  assiduously avoids eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard and I are here, Miles, because  I have learned through bitter  experience that when it comes to  matrimonial law, you are the very  best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles acknowledges this with a curt nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you are well aware, my previous  marriage ended with an unjustified  strain on my reputation My motives  were questioned. I was slandered in  court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good, Massey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Therefore in an effort to remove any  trace of suspicion from my sweet  Howard -- I wish to execute a pre- nuptial agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And -- there's no talking her out of  it. Believe me, I've tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say the Massey pre-nup has never  been penetrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said "penetrate." Heh heh heh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gropes her. She giggles like a teenager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for the love of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is true, isn't it Miles? Your  pre-nup is the best there is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is correct. Not to blow my own  horn, but they devote an entire  semester to it at Harvard Law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvard? Whoa, Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to make sure that you  both --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eyes Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- understand what you're asking for  here. The Massey pre-nup provides  that in the event of a dissolution  of the marriage for any reason, both  parties shall leave it with whatever  they brought in, and earned during.  No one can profit from the marriage.  The pre-nup protects the wealthier  party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- at the moment, that'd be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And without it, that party is exposed --  a sitting duck. No wriggle room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Wriggle Room! Maybe we should put  that in the Malibu house. Screw the  screening room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly sickened) -- and we are sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes boring into Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we are both sure that's what we  want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course I can't do much "wriggling"  if you tie me up like that again.  Massey -- this is one bad bad little  girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) We'd better go before we get thrown  out.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR BANK
dialogues.text: Marylin and Howard wait for an elevator as Miles trots ou to catch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Doyle, if I could  just borrow your charming fiancee  for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just like to have a word with  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? I'm going to have her for a  lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles drags her to the side as Doyle checks his Sports Pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She backs up as he tries to close the space between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To him? He's a sick freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's passionate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passionate! He's a pervert. He should  have to register when he moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All girls enjoy a little rough trade  from time to time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin! Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You listen to me. (Very quiet and  deliberate) You busted me, Miles. You left me  with nothing! What did you expect me  to do? Get a degree in counseling?  Write a book about table linen?  Because that's what wives do when  they get dumped, and frankly, I'm  not quite ready for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We told you. We realized we've always  been in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has backed her against the wall of an alcove which she a flowering ficus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Massey pre-nup has never been  pene -- successfully challenged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I hear. Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fascinate me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She deftly slides out of the way. Miles watches her as sh heads down the hall. As she gets on the elevator, Howard  grabs her butt with one hand, while giving Miles a high s with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles stares at the chessboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm going to end up  like Herb Myerson, with a colostomy  bag instead of a family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any symptoms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The inability to experience  pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That. (beat) Don't waste time with your queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Center Counter Defense. The thing  is not to move your queen too early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't really love that idiot,  can she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin Rexroth. She came into my  office and signed a pre-nup with  Howard Doyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle Oil? (Miles nods) A Massey Pre-nup? (Miles nods again) She loves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the wrong man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles! Don't waste time with someone  else's queen, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind the bower, RABBI BOLENSKY emerges, strumming guitar and singing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parsley sage, rosemary and thyme --  Remember me to one who lives there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pullback reveals Howard D. Doyle before the altar with  Marylin. He is in a tuxedo and yarmulke. She is dressed i simple, Kennedy-type gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- she once was a true love of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last arpeggiated chord rings out; birds tweet, everyo sits. As Miles and Wrigley seat themselves, Wrigley is snifflin Miles is irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it. Even with the  business we're in, I -- it gets me  every time. It's so -- optimistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she going through with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crowd quiets with the end of the song, Wrigley mur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's not going through with it,  she's cutting it awful close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parsley Sage Rosemary and Thyme.  Ingredients. Spices. Spicy ingredients  for the banquet we call -- life.  Marriage is like a Great Feast.  Courtship is the Appetizer. A small  mixed green taste of things to come.  The Early Years -- The First Course --  a carefully poached fish dish  dependent on freshness and delicate  handling. Or perhaps a light pasta --  a tortellini stuffed with cheese and  hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispers, to Miles) You have any gum or mints?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main course -- Mature Love -- a  hearty stew, cooked slowly in the  oven of companionship until the meat  falls off the bone. And then --  dessert. The reward for years spent  together -- the sweetness of a Life  Well Lived. A sorbet of grandchildren,  followed by the decafe demitasse of  retirement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silence, broken only by the twitter of birds and the restlessness of a hungry audience. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you Chaim David Doyle, take Marylin  to be the Barbara to your Wolfgang  though the lean years as well as  those that are heavily marbled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you, Marylin Rexroth, take  Chaim to be the roux in your bechamel?  The stock in your sauce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads turn. Miles bites a knuckle. Birds twitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, by the power vested in me by  the state of California, and as the  maitre'd in the Prix Fixe Four Star  Restaurant of Life, I now pronounce  you -- man and wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kiss. Cheers. Applause.

dialogues.speaker: A RECEPTION ON THE GROUNDS
dialogues.text: Rabbi Bolensky strolls through the crowd with a heaping  platter of smoked salmon. Miles is darkly brooding as Wrigley opens a Tiffany box t show him the contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berry spoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spoons! Honestly Wrigley, I'm  surprised at you. What is this? Some  Martha Stewart suggestion? Those are  the most cockamamie things I've ever --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles -- why so angry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sounds wistful:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't we be the club sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ding Ding -- Howard D. is tapping a knife against his win glass. The crowd quiets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls:  I have something to say to my bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard D. turns to one side to address Marylin, taking on of her hands between his paws, as she beams up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Darling, like the rabbi said...  life is a banquet, A Grand Bouffe,  and Marylin, darling... I just want  you to know that I am IN the kitchen  and I CAN STAND THE HEAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter from the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm going to start this marriage  by EATING MY WORDS. Because the hot  hors d'oerve of this love story is --  Pre-nup Primavera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his breast pocket and withdraws a piece o paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine! Bring on the Pesto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Caterer places a plate and a bowl of sauce in front of  Doyle. Marylin looks on, surprised and bemused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This is for you, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts tearing strips off the piece of paper, dipping  them into the sauce, and eating them. His mouth stuffed w paper, Doyle repeats:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- this is for you, Darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is murmuring--the murmurs grow in volume -- a  smattering of applause -- cheers -- more applause -- wild cheers. Slowly rhythmically, Miles starts thumping his ha together, nodding comprehension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to him Wrigley is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles' hand-clapping accelerates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant. It's brilliant. He's eating  the pre-nup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley's eyes widen. He looks back at Doyle eating the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you, Darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's -- the most romantic thing  I've ever seen -- in my LIFE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS IS FOR YOU, DARLING!

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Marylin stands at the punch bowl accepting congratulation Miles approaches and draws her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to offer my congratulations.  That was a beautiful gesture of  Howard's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard is a beautiful person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He's a diamond in the rough.  And I have a feeling that someday  soon you'll be taking that diamond  and leaving the rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles. Miles. Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thrilled for you, but tell me  this... How'd you get Howard to do  it? I've addressed enough juries to  appreciate the power of suggestion,  but it seemed like he thought it was  his own idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was his idea. It was a gesture of  love and trust. Be happy for me,  Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when this goes south -- promise  you'll have dinner with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (She holds a plate of  food for him) Have you tried the duck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure a couple of months. That's  how long it should take for the ink  on the settlement to dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the plate of food from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has bones. Be sure to swallow  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although knowing you as I do -- there  will be no settlement. This time it  will be complete and total  annihilation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a ROAR we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A uniformed pilot and copilot are cruising the corporate high above a vast ocean of clouds. The pilot is wearing a headset. After a long moment of listening he shakes his h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I've heard some -- I've heard  some sick things -- in my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot reaches above his head and throws a small toggl switch and the cockpit is Awash with the sound of screami laughter and music:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Casey Jones was the rounder's  name, T'was on the 6:02 that he rode  to fame!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screaming with laughter, two naked damsels in conductor's caps are pushing Rex Rexroth around the cabin on a miniat locomotive. He is wearing his railroad boxers and bellowi "The Ballad of Casey Jones."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex Rexroth, the mini-mall king.  Getting to be the richest man on the  West Coast, from what they say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The copilot shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hup! Come all you rounders if you  wanna hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're they going to Muncie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's thinking of buying Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: WHOOOSH -- the plane roars away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course we shall have to  litigate. Sentence. Paragraph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secretary seated by his desk is taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Naturally the first concern for  both parties is the welfare of little  Wendell junior. Nevertheless, we  question whether the continuing  expenses for his special ed classes  are truly justified given the great  strides --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I'm late. I was having  lunch with Ruth Rabinow's assistant.  Guess what? Marylin Rexroth is  divorced!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Delighted) HA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I hear she's richer than  Croesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but is she richer than Mrs.  Croesus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could buy and sell you ten times  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She deserves every penny. They pay  great athletes a fortune. Well,  Marylin Rexroth is an athlete at the  peak of her power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the call button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me Marylin Rexroth Doyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She owes me a meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd stay away from her, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you would, Wrigley. But would  Kramer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the Receptionist Voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Doyle for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move in on one of the tables where Marylin and Miles s as a waiter pours them champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Le Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin, 1982.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he fill Marylin's glass: Raises his own in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel victorious Miles. I  feel betrayed, abandoned and  humiliated. I have pictures of him  with another woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More pictures? My God, Marylin. You  can open an erotic art gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you invite me here to score some  cheap laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just to comfort you, and  appreciate you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reproachfully) You really think I engineered the  whole thing. You think the marriage  and the divorce was part of some  scheme. You came here to celebrate  because you think I'm without morality  or soul. You -- (With difficulty) sound like my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter hands Miles a menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I -- well, I'm not really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not hungry, huh? Neither am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pensive moment. Miles reaches across the table and takes her hand. She le him. He strokes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles drives. Marylin sits silently looking out the windo

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE MANSION
dialogues.text: Miles pulls up to the huge house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And good-night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her hand again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a finger to his lips. Sadly, Miles relinquishes her hand. She exits the car and walks up to the front door. Miles  watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Court TV on in the background. Miles alone in bed reading Art In America.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: A Witness is being examined by the Prosecutor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he asked you if...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..if I reckon I could find someone  to keel him his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who asked you this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean Leonard. Da defendant. (Points to the  defendant) That guy!

dialogues.speaker: CLAP OF THUNDER
dialogues.text: In a boiling night sky. There are distant, echoing wails.

dialogues.speaker: WOOZY DUTCH TRACK
dialogues.text: Along a pointing suitcoated arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen hunnut billable hours. Twelve  hunnut'n twenty-one motions tuh  void...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woozy track finds the cadaverous hand at the end of t arm with an IV tube swinging from it. Miles stands next t the arm. He's holding an assault type weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...five nunnut'n sixty faw summary  judgenents. A hunnut'n twenty-nine  thousand four hunnut'n seventeen  lunches charged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles shoots -- Bonnie falls. Then Mrs. Guttman. Marylin next. Miles hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counseluh? Counseluh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles points the gun at Herb. RING. RING. RING.

dialogues.speaker: MILES BEDROOM
dialogues.text: He bolts up in bed, sweating.

dialogues.speaker: RING
dialogues.text: He gazes stuporously about, reaching for the ringing phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Marylin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right about me. I am worthless.  I am nothing. I don't deserve to  live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin? When did I say...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame them for betraying me.  I don't blame Rex, or Howard or my  father. You see, Miles, I'm going to  tell you something about me. Something  you may or may not know. I suck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the SCREECH of Tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at someone) Screw you, asswipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin? Forgive me but are you --  drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little. (Scream) You get out of the car. That's right,  Fuctard. I'm talkin' to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be driving. Where are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on Sunset. Near the Beverly Hills  hotel. Wanna meet me for a drink in  the Polo...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live right near there. The 800  Block of Maple. Come here. Marylin --  come here right now before -- just  come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Should I stop at Starbucks and  pick up a blended for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin sits in the den. She's had some coffee and, altho teary and disheveled, is no longer psychotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just cried when I got home. Somehow,  your disdain for me -- I'm pretty  tough Miles, but I'm human. All my  life people have been ascribing these  terrible motives to me. I used to  think they were jealous, or they  didn't understand, but... I dunno.  Maybe others see something in me.  Something I'm not even aware of.  Anyway, thank you for letting me  come here. I guess I was a little  drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the coffee cup and has a sip. She looks like a  lost waif.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a very nice home, Miles.  Very inviting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have wonderful art. I love that  lithograph. Hockney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I just got that, actually. It  was a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a -- girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. I don't have a... no. It was  from a client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding. I'll bet you have some  very grateful clients. What'd Rex  buy you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex sent me two humidors full of pre- Castro Cubans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin looks at a photograph Miles has on a side table. A WOMAN AND TWO SMALL BOYS. The Woman has her arm around one of them. The other stand close to her. Smiling, but awkward and tentative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. And that is -- mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mom. Mom and brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you were a very  sensitive child. You have expressive  eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles walks over to look at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your mother was very beautiful.  She must be proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never particularly cared for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She loved me. She would never  not love her son. She just didn't...  I wasn't her "type." She said I was  a very, colicky baby. You know?  Difficult. Not a good sleeper? Didn't  eat well? We got off to a bad start,  and she never seemed to recoup --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She held that against you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently she was very disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy. Boy, oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin looks at the picture again. And yes -- you can se how hesitant Miles was. Marylin is moved. A flash of some genuine crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here I thought my mother was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right. You met Patricia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a sip of coffee. Regards Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're damaged goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
