dialogues.text: We are, Miles. You know I'm right.  There's something "off" about you  and me Miles. And maybe it isn't  because of these women -- maybe they  were just extremely insightful and  recognized our "deficiencies" very  early on. Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is bullshit! Mine is a bitch  and yours is a psycho. I can't believe  you're saying this, Marylin! There's  nothing wrong with us. We're  attractive and charismatic and  successful and... I like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Miles. You shouldn't listen  to me. I'm sure you have a very  fulfilling life. I'd better go. I'm  depressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the coffee. It's very  robust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands. Picks up her purse. Walks over to him with an outstretched hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go. Stay with me for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't release her hand. Instead he draws her to him, and kisses her. She kisses him. He kisses her back. She..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mile and Marylin -- making love.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: They are in post coital wrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to say -- I'm speechless. No.  I'm never speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little embarrassed. I'm not  used to losing control with such --  volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm not used to -- Marylin --  there's something I want to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want... I want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be your -- your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... That wasn't right. I want YOU  to be MY wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just propose to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I am. What else could those  words mean? I believe we belong  together and we can make one another  happy. And we should be happy because  happiness is better than the  alternative which is -- just jump in  any old time, Marylin. You have more  experience at this than I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Yes, you do have more experience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Miles. I accept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to sleep on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to sleep on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ma'am. I have been asleep all my  life up to this moment. Marylin,  will you marry me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs. Kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Kenneth wait. Dressed in suits. Miles looks ner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy for you, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she Asian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asian? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley, rushes in, carrying a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth this is my associate, Wrigley.  Wrigley this is my friend, Dr. Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plastic surgeon! I read about  you in LA Style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the pre-nup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I have the ring. Was I supposed  to have a pre-nup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You have the ring. Wrigley has  the pre-nup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I thought maybe -- (He sees someone) Gee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin enters. She looks outstanding. Her friends, Sarah Sorkin and Ramona Barcelona (who is now visibly pregnant) accompany her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Beck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know each other? Of course you  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Dr. Beck? I have an appointment  to see you in March. Right after I  lose the babyweight. Which of course,  will be after I have the baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah Sorkin. Ramona Barcelona --  this is Miles Massey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Hello. (To Marylin) Marylin. You know my young associate,  Wrigley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. He was at my divorce and my  wedding. What would a marital related  event be without Wrigley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has become a tradition, hasn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved the berry spoons. (Wrigley beams) I didn't have any. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Wrigley brought something else  for you today, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley pulls a sheaf of papers from the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This -- is the Massey Pre-nup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley hastily pulls a ballpoint from his pocket and cli it. Miles grabs the pre-nup, and as he turns to Marylin, tone softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin, you're welcome to examine  it, but as you know -- it's iron  clad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. It's famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to reach Ruth, but we couldn't  get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanted Ruth here for your  protection as well --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge is here. Over here, Judge  Munson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't she the Judge at my divorce  hearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Short notice you know, but I  think there's nice closure to it.  Hello Judge Muson. A pleasure as  always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up with you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the gag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gag? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin looks at the pre-nup. Then pulls Miles aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Judge Muson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, Patty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Miles) You brought a pre-nup to our wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (She isn't having the  expected reaction) It's for your protection, sweetheart.  You're the one with the -- the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the coin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles. I don't want to sign this. I  want this marriage to be different.  Okay. Judge Munsen and Wrigley are  here, but other than that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I go out for a smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Judge -- just a sec. But Marylin,  if we sign it, I can't hope to benefit  from the marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sadly) Oh Miles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I mean is, your wealth is  completely protected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if a lead veil had been drawn across. She looks deep i his eyes. Into his soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles. Listen to me. You are about  to become my husband. I don't want  to be protected from you. I want to  be protected for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Moved) Ohhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this to be a marriage based  on love, trust and community property.  That's all I've ever wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Marylin, without this, you're  completely exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a sitting duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Miles, with great  affection) Quack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Marylin stand before the alter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, Miles Herbert Massey of Massey  Meyerson take Marylin Hamilton-Rexroth- Doyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Doyle", to be your lawful wedded  wife to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, yah I do, uh huh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me finish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glares at Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jesus! Haven't you ever been  married before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastened, Miles bows his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- To have and hold, to love and to  cherish, till death do you part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long beat, through which Miles stares at his s Marylin looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you, Marylin Hamilton-Rexroth  Doyle, take Miles Herbert Massey of  Massey Meyerson, to be your lawful  wedded husband, to have and to hold,  to love and to cherish, till death  do you part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I now pronounce you man and wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Marylin asleep in bed. The ALARM RINGS. Miles w turns to his beautiful wife -- kisses her good morning. She gives him a sleepy Smile. Miles dressing for work. Marylin, in a Sabia Rosa bathrob places a tray with coffee next to him. He holds up two ti for her-approval. She selects one. He puts it on. Miles and Marylin reading Newspapers while eating breakfa She serves him a bowl of fruit and indicates Wrigley's be spoons. They laugh heartily. Marylin waves good bye as Miles backs drives to the offic She waves at the gardeners who blow palm fronds around th lawn.

dialogues.speaker: MILES OFFICE
dialogues.text: He has managed to fill his credenza with pictures of marr life. Due to its brevity -- these pictures are uneventful the Massey's wear the same outfit in most of them. Miles works. He is interrupted by the voice of his SECRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have Mrs. Massey on line one for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs and laughs. We hear Marylin's laughter coming  through the receiver. Miles exits a flower store with a bouquet of tulips. Mary at the doorway, greets Miles as he arrives home. As Miles changes into his casual after work outfit, (khak Marylin sits at the edge of the bed. He's telling her abo his day, and she is rapt with attention. The Massey's have a candlelit dinner of fish and pasta. T tulips are in the middle of the table. Miles and Marylin snuggle on a couch and watch Seinfeld.  Miles in bed on the new Frette Linen. A few too many pill but he's making it work. Marylin enters the bedroom in a  nightshirt that is the perfect combination of innocence a nastiness. He puts down his book as she gets into bed wit him. They gaze at one another -- the picture of contentment an impending lust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is addressing the young associates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in my life, I  stand before you naked...  vulnerable... and in love. Love. A  word matrimonial lawyers shy away  from. Ironic isn't it -- that I have  been frightened of this emotion which  is, in a sense, the seed of my  livelihood. But today, I am here to  tell you: Love should cause us no  fear. Love should cause us no shame.  Love... is good. (He lets it sink in) Let me ask you a question. When our  clients come to us confused, angry,  hurting because their flame of love  is fluttering and threatens to die --  should we seek to extinguish that  flame, so that we can sift through  the smoldering wreckage for our paltry  reward? Or should we seek to fan  this precious flame -- this most  precious flame -- back to loving,  roaring life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young associates look confused. Wrigley raises his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extinguish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we counsel fear -- or trust?  Should we seek to destroy -- or to  build? Should we meet our clients'  problems with cynicism -- or with  love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (another raised hand) Kramer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Build?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decision of course, is each of  ours. For my part, I have made the  leap of love, and there is no going  back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb Myserson sits in the back of the room. He watches,  breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Marylin watching a cable movie crowded together the small sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm squishing you. I'll  move to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stay. I want you close to me.  This couch is wrong. It's not a  "married couch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He surveys his surroundings with a critical eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I could sit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, this is not a married house --  it's a bachelor pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly. You have six bedrooms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But I've converted most of  them into ridiculous "Guy" rooms --  a billiard room, a card room, a gym --  Honey, want you to go out, as soon  as you feel up to it -- and buy  married things. Woman things.  Personalize it. Marylinize it. Make  this your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my card. Spend as much as you  want. We get mileage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose I could "girly" it  up for you with a little Fortuny,  and some passementerie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (Beat) Are those foods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabric and fringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. And then -- maybe -- not  right away -- There's a room right  off the bedroom -- It would be perfect  for a nursery. (He takes her hands) It's a walk in humidor right now --  but if I took out the refrigeration  unit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think a nursery should be right  off the master suite. My parents put  mine in the guest house. Apparently  they did have a Fisher Price intercom,  but my mother turned it off when I  was seven months old because I was  so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops him with a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want children, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pricey antique store near Melrose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said 'yes' didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up an antique Chinese bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Ming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Ming. It's Tong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Tong older than Ming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Ming is older than Tong. (To the Salesman  hovering nearby) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a Chinese Prayer Bowl. It's  Chen dynasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. I'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets it aside next to the formidable pile of loot the  girls have accumulated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this anymore. Let's get  some lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about rugs? I thought we were  stopping at Mansour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Marylin) And will this be check or --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the Platinum Visa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Glances at it) Very good, Mrs. Massey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trots off with the card. Marylin absently fingers an antique guided candelabra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sigh) Well. He said to "make the house  mine."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy. If he only knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess. You know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not what I expected. He's very --  he's so -- happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're going through with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, it's just -- you know I've  never been the first wife. Rex was  married before me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is different. He's still so  idealistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's about to change big  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has no cynicism or anger. For  once I'm not the repository of rage  at some other woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, you'll have your own rage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is buying a huge bouquet of flowers. As he exits he stopped by a WOMAN. She is in her 40's but looks older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Miles Massey! You probably  don't recognize me. The drugs made  me put on weight and grow facial  hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ruined my life you sonofabitch.  Gimme those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the flowers. Pulls petal off one of the roses a eats it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my brother got you. He got you,  you slimeball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE runs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you... (To the nurse) Is she yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard Doyle is my brother? You know  my brother, Howard Doyle. You do  know my brother, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Sir. Emily. Give the man  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know Howard Doyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tricked you. With a phony wife  and a fake pre-nup. Howard Doyle. He  got you. You married Marylin, didn't  you? You thought she had money. HA  HA HA. Howard Doyle made you think  that because of what you did to me.  And to Marylin Rexroth. Yeah. I heard  all about it. My brother Howard Doyle  got you. (singsong) Neener neener neener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth calmly watches Miles ranting around her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He divorced his wife -- he married  Marylin -- he divorced Marylin --  and he -- remarried his WIFE? What  kind of sick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin was friends with Howard and  Amanda Doyle. They don't like the  way you operate. They helped her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never ate the pre-nup, did he!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what Howard Doyle  eats. I'm not a damn dietician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Marylin end up with money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's YOUR wife. Why don't you ask  her? Anyway, I assume she signed the  highly over rated Massey pre-nup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a pre-nup

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles hangs his head. Ruth sighs sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The fault, dear Brutus, is not in  our stars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that crap. That's MY  crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have you suspended. I'll have  you disbarred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't threaten me, Miles. I did  nothing illegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...why did she do it, Ruth? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's attorney client privilege. (As she goes back  into her work) Sorry, Miles. But as a great and  clever man once said, What's good  for the goose --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin greets him at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings him inside. The place has been massively  accessorized. Antiques, rugs, lamps and assorted tasteful chatchkies. There is a new Biedermeyer couch in the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta Da.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks at it, expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her -- a very dark look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Flatly) I love you. I want to have your baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong Miles? Did I spend too  much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She retrieves all the receipts from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles. I have a very good relationship  with all the salesmen. I can return  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you Marylin? Can you return the  trust? Can you return the hopes? The  dreams? Can you just... (Bitterly) SEND IT ALL BACK FOR STORE CREDIT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles? You're scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pulls himself together) I'm sorry, Darling. I love it. It's  chic and timeless and elegant and  eclectic and. It's you, Marylin. It  is YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin is on the phone with Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Ruth -- things have changed --  yes -- yes I understand. But you see --  I couldn't file, did I? And maybe I  wasn't going to file. Maybe -- maybe  Ruth -- Yes. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: The bedroom door is closed. Marylin knocks repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles? Open the door, Miles. Please  open the door. I want to talk to  you. Miles? I'm coming in. Here I  come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the door open. No Miles in sight. On the bed,  scrawled on a piece of mMm stationery, taped to one of th mMm Frette pillows -- a note which reads -- "If you prick us, do we not bleed? If you tickle us, do we not laugh? I you poison us, do we not die? AND IF YOU WRONG US SHALL W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth stares at the chessboard. Court TV is on the  background.

dialogues.speaker: COURT TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: We are back at the Trial of New Jersey v. Medrano. Mr. Me is accused of killing his wife, Alicia in 1992. He claims was suicide. Let's return to the courtroom. See the action in the courtroom -- The Prosecutor shows the jury an extremely large handgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far would this gun have to be in  order to inflict a wound without  leaving powder burns on the scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approximately three feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how could Mrs. Medrano shoot  herself in the back of the head from  a distance of three feet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really long arms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves a piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't get a conviction. The  husband called it in as a suicide.  The forensic guys weren't thinking  murder. I'm sure some of the evidence  was compromised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your move, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sadly) I already made my move, Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A private yoga class. Marylin, Sarah and Ramona are in th plow position. The yuppie Sikh instructor places his weig on Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vishu! Knock it off. That hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah tries a few deep breaths. Marylin concentrates hard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good, Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know where he is. He  looked so devastated. If I could  just talk to him for a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that the bell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounded like a bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin walks to the door. Opens it. Two POLICE OFFICERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin Hamilton Rexroth Doyle Massey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a warrant for your arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin is photographed front and profile. She is finger  printed; she is searched and relieved of her jewelry; and finally, she is throw into a holding tank with several ot women -- trapped. She clings despondently to the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth is admitted to the holding area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Police Officer walks down the hall. Unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go now, Mrs. Massey. Someone  made bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin sits next to Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgery and Fraud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used his credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me to -- he said he wanted  me to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a little shopping spree. How  do you spend six figures in less  than six hours? Oh, never mind I've  seen it before. I've seen everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he set me up? Do you  think that was his intention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I know his intention? Or yours  for that matter? (Sighs) I should join Sam. I'm too old for  this bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never even asked. He just assumed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was right, wasn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? Well, Marylin, now you cut a  deal or find out how Jean Harris  made it work for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles opens the door. Marylin is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Well. Well. Look who made bail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe I should grab my  mace. I'm a civil attorney. I have  little experience with "the criminal  mind."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just like to pick up a few of my  things

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you have "things."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary. We're married and  we have no pre-nup, so a case could  be made that everything in here is  mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin walks into the den. Sits on the new sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to nail you ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me, because I'm  sure that's a violation of the terms  of your bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm reporting you to the IRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The IRS? They owe me. I'm expecting  a refund.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs. She looks at him, dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm clean with the IRS. I've reported  every dollar I've ever made. Try  again, girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about dollars,  studmuffin. I'm talking about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens a humidor and takes out a Cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUFF. (Chomping on the Cigar) Got a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of "stuff?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches into her purse. Pulls out a Dunhill and exper lights the cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arty Farty stuff. (Pointing to the  Hockney) Lithographs and pre Castro Cubans.  Watches and mileage on private jets.  Stuff, Miles. Stuff you get from  grateful clients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salary. Unreported income. (Glancing at his watch) By the way, what time IS it on  Bellagio Road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't prove anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to. That's what the IRS  guys do. And they do it with great  zeal. See, they work at these tortuous  civil service jobs, and when five  hundred dollar an hour boys like you  take their trade out in luxury  goodies, these saps feel.. well,  they feel like saps. And they feel  bitter and they feel vengeful and  they feel WRATH. (Puffing on the cigar) What is this? A Romeo and Julieta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your league, Marylin.  Rexroth was a primate. I'm a  professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. So am I, right? And so is  Agent Wilson of the Internal Revenue  Service. He's a dedicated, underpaid  graduate of Southwestern University --  very tenacious, and never more so  than when he's dealing with an  unscrupulous colleague. (She stands to leave) I think it's only fair to warn you:  I'm going to file an action, Miles.  And after a decent interval I plan  to have Ruth seek an injunction that  will forbid your approach within 500  feet of my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the residence will be part  of the settlement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did our marriage ever mean anything  to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the bogus forgery charge and  I'll forget about your generous  friends slash clients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's blackmail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a peck on the cheek. As she leaves:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll always be my favorite husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sits dejectedly on the new sofa looking at the  paintings. He looks at the watch. And the cigars. And the picture of his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity you can't be here. You'd enjoy  this.

dialogues.speaker: A BAG OF FLUIDS
dialogues.text: We pull back from the milky yellowish bag of fluid to sho that a nurse is unhooking and removing it from under Herb Meyerson's wheelchair where it collects drainage. She now places it up on the IV gantry and connects, and s the now empty drip under the wheelchair to collect draina We are once again in Herb Meyerson's gloomy office, its  venetians blocking most of the light and making Herb a da enigmatic figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This woman has humbled, shamed and  disgrazed the entire foim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reverse shows Miles standing in front of Herb's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Herb,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counseluh, this foim deals in powuh.  This foim deals in p'seption. This  foim cannot prospuh... nor long  endowwa. if it is p'seeved as dancin'  to the music..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves his free arm to the beat of music unheard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- of the hoidy-goidy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand Herb... I just... for  the first time in my career -- I  don't know what to do. I'm a patsy.  A sitting duck. I'm lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost! I'll tell you what you can do,  you can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings himself up short and turns to the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- leave us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You can act like a man. Let me  tell you sumpn, smart guy. You tawt  you had it all figgud out. Trust.  Marriage. All ya goddamn love love  love. Well now you lissean me. I'm  gonna talk to you about the goddamn  LAW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs unsteadily to his feet and tries to pace,  gesticulating, with the IV swaying dangerously behind him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We SOIVE THE LAW! We HONUH the  law! We make our goddamn bread and  BUTTUH by the law! And sometimes,  counseluh, we OBEY THE LAW --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses to let this sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but conseluh -- This is not one a  those times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is in bed, morosely watching Court TV.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Close on NIKKI ROSEN - A COURT TV ANCHOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are interrupting our scheduled  weekend coverage because we have  just received word there is a verdict  in the Kentucky v Leonard Case. We  now join the case -- live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reads) Of the charges of murder in the first  degree, we the jury find the defendant --  not guilty.

dialogues.speaker: THE STUDIO
dialogues.text: Nikki speaks to her Guest Host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simpson started a trend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An edgy looking gangster, JOE. He is perspiring heavily. breathes through his mouth with the rasping wheeze of an  asthmatic. His labored breath rattles as he stares across the table someone off. At length, a voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Are you Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still staring, but perhaps by way of answer, the gangster raises an inhaler, sticks it in his mouth, and squeezes.  WHUSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Dumbarton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reverse shows Miles seated across a small round table i seedy low-lit clam house. Photos of Ted Kennedy and the P adorn the walls..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am here representing Mr. Dumbarton,  on a... matter of some delicacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the pigeon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you want me to kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- I, uh, that is to say Mr.  Dumbarton -- would like you to uh,  neutralize a, uh, business associate  by the name of Marylin Rexroth Doyle  Massey uh Dumbart -- uh, Massey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that... one person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's her picture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is shoving an envelope across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the address where she's  staying. It's the residence of a Mr.  Massey. Uh, Dumbarton. Massey. Uh,  it's not Mr. Dumbarton's house. Though  he's not involved. And because of an  impending legal action this needs to  happen within a certain... time frame.  Uh... on an expedited basis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gangster stares expressionlessly. He raises the inhal again and, with his eyes still on Miles, squeezes. WHUSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dumbarton is, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Finally, Miles explodes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't suffer, will she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bites a knuckle, gazing fearfully at the gangster. The gangster stares impassively back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...not unless you pay extra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous oak paneled room. Furnished with chairs sofas and a huge circular bed. A fire roars in the far corner. the wall above the bed a film loop is being projected --  soft core pornographic images. On the bed, Rex is surrounded by three naked beauties, sm in cola dust and wearing conductor caps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been working on the railroad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the livelong day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been working on the railroad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to pass the time away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can'tcha hear the whistle... the  whistle... AWWWWWWW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex hunches over, clutching his left arm. One by one, the girls stop dancing and stare. There is a  somber silence, broken by another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awwwwwww --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are all watching now. One of them steps forward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Whatsa matter, Rexie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guest room. Dark, dirty and filled with empty bottles o expensive French wine. We hear a phone ringing in a different room. It rings sev times. The figure on the bed stirs, rolls over, moans, clamps a  pillow over his head. The ring of the distant telephone is interrupted and we h a muffled voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Yes, he's here. Just a minute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear approaching footsteps and Kenneth enters the  background, knotting a bathrobe. He turns on the light in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles. It's for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure on the couch pulls away the pillow. It is inde Miles Massey. He blearily takes the offered phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Yes -- what?! Yes -- I see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After another listening beat he drops the phone away. He  remains staring dully out into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Marvin Untermeyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was Rex Rexroth's personal  attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex just had a massive coronary. In  the middle of a business meeting.  He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth is mildly puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that. But you  weren't close, were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin says that Rex's will is four  years old. He never redrafted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles voice is still flat, expressionless:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything goes to Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up a at Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's rich. We're still married. We  have no pre-nup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, that's good, right?

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Miles paces with the telephone. He punches numbers with t thumb of the hand holding the phone; his other hand holds coffee cup from which he takes trembling slurps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Joe. Wuddya need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe. This is Mr. uh... friend of --  we met. This is to instruct you it's  No Go! Do you understand me?! NO GO  on Marylin Rexroth Doyle -- No Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was -- oh, shit. What if he's  on his way over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consumed with remorse, Miles moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin! What have I done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but don't call me  Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: MILES CAR
dialogues.text: Miles drives, speeding, taking corners hard while punchin numbers into his car phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her out, buy some time; get her  out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom, the phone starts ringing. A hand enters t pick it up. We follow the hand up to reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles? Miles! Where have you been?  I've been trying to get in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to leave the house  immediately!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Miles. I will leave. But  Miles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No buts. Now. Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen to me. I'm sorry, Miles.  It's true that my initial intention  was to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Leave the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did I. Now pack up a few basics  and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? You do love me?

dialogues.speaker: MASSEY MANSION
dialogues.text: Marylin hangs up the phone. She walks slowly around the room, pausing at the mantelpi to pick up a framed picture of Miles, which she  contemplatively regards. We pan with her continued walk to bring Joe into frame. H stands with his back pressed to the wall. She's started f a moment, but quickly recoups:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever sent you, I'll pay double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dumbarton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows him the picture of Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Mr. Dumbarton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cocks an eye at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Triple!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the pigeon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We faintly hear a car screeching to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massey exits the car. He clutches a can of mace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a key scrape in the lock. The front door swings o onto a dark foyer as Miles tiptoes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispers) Marylin?

dialogues.speaker: DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Miles tiptoes through, looking warily about. He backs thr the swinging doors connecting to the kitchen. Finds himse face to face with Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe! Thank God you're in time. You're  not in time. I'm in time. Thank God  I'm in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a no go! Get it? No one any the  wiser. Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a cow-herding motion with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go home now! Goodbye! Thanks  so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe takes out his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no! No contract! It's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has no effect on Joe who is unscrewing his silencer. Miles is exasperated. Suddenly -- Marylin appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a no go, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe glances at both of them with barely concealed contemp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! He works for YOU?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. But first, he worked for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to have this thug...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait just a second there. You sent  him here. You unearthed this  pestilence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're calling me a pestilence? That's  a hoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Joe) I'm sorry. That was unkind and --  but, we changed our minds. (To Miles) Did you really mean what you said on  the phone. It wasn't because you  found out about Rex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonono. Marylin -- I'm your husband.  I'd be entitled to Rex's money. No  matter what happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme tell you something. You are  the pestilence. I'm the exterminator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Joe, be happy for us. I'll pay  you the twenty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fifty for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Miles) That's cause you're a lawyer. I gave  her the lawyer discount. (Looks at Marylin) But I shouldn't of. Cause you're a  whore. A whore who worships the  dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually, all whores worship  the dollar, if you want to get  technical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. I was a lawyer. Just like  you. And my clients? Whores just  like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you with a firm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan? I know Kaplan. Wait. You're  Joe Gittelson? I knew you looked --  You were great -- we studied you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years in "matrimonial law"  and it made me sick. (He wheezes) I broke up homes and families, never  givin' it a second thought. Till one  day. I had an epiphany. You know  what that is? (They nod) Came with a damn stigmata if you can  believe that! I said to myself --  Joe -- everyone you see wants blood.  Everyone wants their ex's dead. So  why jerk around with rest. You wanna  best serve your clients? Kill em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is raising the gun at Miles. Miles sprays him with Ma BANG -- Joe fires blindly, scrunching his eyes against th chemical, sucking for breath like a jet engine revving fo take-off. SLAM -- Marylin elbows him in the face, breaking his nose She finishes with a solid groin kick. It slows him down, doesn't stop him. Joe stumbles a bit, but regains his footing. BANG -- Joe is rampaging around the room, still firing,  thumping at his chest with his free hand for his inhaler. Marylin runs to Miles. He takes her hand and they run tow the door, seeking egress. BANG -- still firing, he pulls out the inhaler but blindl bobbles it. Joe reaches with his gun hand to keep the inhaler from  falling. He momentarily bobbles both gun and inhaler. Miles pops up in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin. Run. I'll distract him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving you. I took self  defense

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe recovers and raises the gun to his mouth as he points the inhaler at Miles. He squeezes -- WHUSH -- Miles squints against the asthma  mist and lets out a horrified:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! The off-screen gunshot is followed by the sound of body dropping heavily to the floor. Silence. Marylin runs over to Miles. They look sadly down at the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE told him it was no go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley sits bouncing the steepled fingers of one hand ag the other. Miles sits gazing sadly out the window. The room is empty. There is the whir of ventilation. The click of the door attracts both their attention and b them to their feet. Marylin walks in, chic and beautiful as ever, followed by Ruth, who sits next to her, places her attachГ© case on t table top, and snaps its clasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Marylin are looking at each other. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to believe this is the way it  will end up for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not something I wanted either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then -- I guess -- something  inside me died when I realized that  you'd hired a goon to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I know. It's exactly how I felt  when I realized you'd hired the goon  to kill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you both wait a minute. Nobody  hired anyone to kill anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear, hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an uncomfortable shifting in seats. Wrigley look at Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, from what I can gather,  a burglar broke into your house --  became despondent over his lifestyle  and shot himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is still looking at Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does that leave us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've outlined a settlement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes a piece of paper across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think it's more than generous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles ignores the paper, which lies unclaimed on the midd of the table. He looks at Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client is prepared to consider a  reconciliation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin looks a Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I trust you, after... after  all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, staring at Marylin, cuts in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wounded me first, Marylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your forgetting Rex Rexroth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're forgetting Howard Doyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgery? Fraud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Income tax evasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how we can ever find our  way back from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, with his eyes still on Marylin, reaches into his s coat. He withdraws a piece of paper, spreads it flat on t table in front of him and, still gazing at her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... there's nothing in the  Massey pre-nup that says it can't be  executed after the parties wed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He decisively clicks the button on a ballpoint pen, looks down at the paper in front of him and scribbles his name. He pushes the paper across the table toward Marylin. Gazing at him, seeking the truth in his eyes, she absentl picks up the paper. There is a long silence. We hear only the hum of ventilat and Wrigley's quiet snuffling. Ruth is looking down her nose through her glasses -- over Marylin's shoulder -- at the sheet of paper. Marylin howe looks only at Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Massey pre-nup --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marylin rips the paper in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bored) O-kay. I'm going back to the office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrigley sobs openly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Wrigley, I'll buy you a drink  and an anti depressant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will ever love me that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you're lucky. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles rises slowly to his feet. He puts his knuckles on the tabletop and leans forward. Marylin rises slowly to her feet. She leans forward. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a SMASHING -- BREAKING. Gardeners look up briefly from the leaf blowing -- but qu prioritize and continue blasting sycamore leaves from one end of the yard to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smashing is becoming louder.

dialogues.speaker: AN AXE
dialogues.text: Breaks the beautiful wood panelling in the room next to t master suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Just wait for one minute. Sweet  Jesus, are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: CONSTRUCTION WORKER LOOKS UP
dialogues.text: he's the one wielding the axe. His co-worker casts a look our direction.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: reaches under the rubble and removes one box of Cohiba  Especials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. Massey. Thought you cleared  that shit out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, man... those things'll  kill ya. I know all you old boomer  potheads like em. They're illegal,  and you get to put em in fancy boxes --  but -- shit man! It's still tobacco.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARYLIN
dialogues.text: Mightily pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, sweets, he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles casts a rueful look at the cigars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-Castro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. They were created during a  dictatorship. (Placing a protective  hand on her BIG belly) What if something happened to you?  What would I tell little Gus when he  asked "what was my daddy like?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks at the box, then at his wife. He tosses the b to the concerned construction worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, buddy. These are for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The construction worker gives him a very hostile look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mumbles) Great. Now I can die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. You'd say "they devoted a whole  semester at Harvard to your Dad. But  your Mom was the one that ever only  nailed his ass."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so.
